title: Behavior Imaging and the Study of Autism

And then sort of specifically to the treatment of video, I would say that I believe that the temporal dimension of video, which ironically, is the thing that characterizes video in some senses being different from still images, really is largely unexplored in the sense that most of our previous methods for dealing with video have been kind of dimensional extensions of spatial techniques.
